revised_title: Synthesis and Analysis of New Phosphorus-, Arsenic-, and Antimony-Based Compounds
tldr: A. W. Hofmann discovered a new method to synthesize triethylarsine and triethylstibine by using zincethyl on terchlorides of arsenic and antimony. He also found a series of compounds with remarkable properties, including platinum and gold salts, which he analyzed and described in this article.
